text: Found on skin; cause boils produces a transmembrane electrochemical gradient, a kind of “biobattery” called the proton motive force (details are discussed in Section 14.2).
Other anaerobes have enzymes the use of alternative (non-oxygen) electron acceptors that the organism needs to make energy.
Table 5.2 gives examples of microbes that grow at different levels of oxygen.
Despite its importance for aerobic respiration, oxygen and its breakdown products are dangerously reactive—a serious problem for all cells.

The overall process of electron transport and proton motive force generation is called respiration if the electron donor is from an organic source and lithotrophy if the source is inorganic (discussed in Chapters 13 and 14).
Anaerobes will grow at the bottom of the tube shown in As we will discuss later, some bacteria previously considered strict anaerobes are not so strict.
As a result, different species have evolved to either tolerate or avoid oxygen altogether.
because they are vulnerable to reactive oxygen molecules by their own metabolism.
